```{r}
library(data.table)

library(ggplot2)
library(patchwork)
library(colorspace)
```

## Focal strategy data

Load generation strategy data.

```{r}
files = list.files(
  "data/results/morph_data", 
  pattern = "csv",
  full.names = TRUE
)

data_all = lapply(files, fread)
data_all = rbindlist(data_all)

df_strat = data_all[(dispersal == 2) & (infect_percent == F)]
df_strat = df_strat[(cost == 0.25) & (regen == 50)]

# popsize
popsize = 500
df_strat[, prop := N / popsize]
g_bin = 100
df_strat[, gen_bin := (floor(gen / g_bin) * g_bin)]

# get time since pathogen
sgen = 3000
genmax = 5000
df_strat[, gen_abs := gen_bin - sgen]

# focus on generations before and after spillover
df_strat[, gen_abs := fifelse(
  abs(gen - sgen) < g_bin, gen - sgen, gen_abs
)]

# save for plotting and upload
fwrite(
  df_strat,
  file = "data/results/data_default_strategy_evo.csv"
)
```

```{r}
# load saved data
df_strat = fread("data/results/data_default_strategy_evo.csv")
```

## Plot evolutionary change in default scenario

```{r}
fig_evo_social_strategy =
ggplot(df_strat[
  social_strat != "non-handler tracking"
])+
  stat_summary(
    aes(
      gen_abs, prop, 
      colour = social_strat,
    ),
    geom = "line"
  )+
  stat_summary(
    aes(
      gen_abs, prop, 
      col = social_strat,
    ),
    size = 0.2
  )+
  geom_vline(
    xintercept = c(0, 25, 250),
    lty = 2,
    size = 0.3,
    col = c("red", "grey", "grey")
  )+
  scale_colour_discrete_sequential(
    palette = "Viridis",
    l2 = 80,
    rev = F,
    name = NULL,
    limits = c("agent avoiding", "agent tracking", "handler tracking"),
    labels = stringr::str_to_sentence,
    na.value = "lightgrey"
  )+
  scale_x_continuous(
    trans = ggallin::pseudolog10_trans,
    breaks = c(-25, 0, 25, 250, 2000),
    labels = scales::comma_format(
      accuracy = 1
    ),
    name = "Gens. after pathogen intro.",
    sec.axis = sec_axis(
      trans = function(x) x + sgen,
      breaks = c(1, sgen, genmax),
      labels = scales::comma_format(
        accuracy = 1
      ),
      name = "Generations"
    )
  )+
  scale_y_continuous(
    breaks = c(0, 0.5, 1),
    labels = scales::percent,
    name = "% Individuals"
  )+
  coord_cartesian(
    xlim = c(-25, NA)
  )+
  theme_test(
    base_family = "Arial",
    base_size = 8
  )+
  theme(
    legend.position = "top", 
    legend.key.height = unit(1, "mm"),
    legend.key.width = unit(2, "mm"),
    axis.text.x = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
    axis.text.y = element_text(
      angle = 90, hjust = 0.5  
    )
  )
```

## Data social information importance

```{r}
files = list.files(
  "data/results/si_imp_data", 
  pattern = "csv",
  full.names = TRUE
)

data_all = lapply(files, fread)
data_all = rbindlist(data_all)

df_si = data_all[(dispersal == 2) & (infect_percent == F)]
df_si = df_si[(cost == 0.25) & (regen == 50)]

# popsize
popsize = 500

df_si[, prop := N / popsize]
g_bin = 100
df_si[, gen_bin := (floor(gen / g_bin) * g_bin)]

# get time since pathogen
sgen = 3000
genmax = 5000
df_si[, gen_abs := gen_bin - sgen]

# focus on generations before and after spillover
df_si[, gen_abs := fifelse(
  abs(gen - sgen) < g_bin, gen - sgen, gen_abs
)]

# save for plotting and upload
fwrite(
  df_si,
  file = "data/results/data_default_si_imp.csv"
)
```

```{r}
# load saved data
df_si = fread("data/results/data_default_si_imp.csv")
```

```{r}
# get weighted mean and variance in social info importance
# replicate 2 is an anomaly with very high SI use, although strategies are
# similar across replicates
df_si_mean = df_si[repl != 2, list(
  mean = weighted.mean(si_imp, w = N),
  sd = Hmisc::wtd.var(si_imp, weights = N)
), by = "gen"]

df_si_mean[, c("y", "ymin", "ymax") := list(
  mean,
  mean - sd,
  mean + sd
)]
```

### Figure social information importance

```{r}
hmap_cols = colorspace::sequential_hcl(
  5,
  palette = "",
  rev = TRUE
)

fig_evo_si_importance =
  ggplot()+
  geom_tile(
    data = df_si[repl == 7], #7
    aes(
      gen, si_imp,
      fill = N / popsize
    )
  )+
  geom_pointrange(
    data = df_si_mean[
      gen %% 100 == 0
    ],
    aes(
      gen, y,
      ymin = ymin,
      ymax = ymax
    ),
    size = 0.1,
    col = alpha("grey40", 1),
  )+
  geom_hline(
    yintercept = 0.5,
    col = "grey",
    lty = 2,
    size = 0.2
  )+
  geom_vline(
    xintercept = c(sgen, sgen + 250),
    lty = 2,
    size = 0.3,
    col = c("red", "grey")
  )+
  annotate(
    geom = "text",
    x = sgen + 250, y = 0.4,
    label = "G = 250 gens\nafter introduction",
    colour = "grey", hjust = 0,
    size = 2
  )+
  scale_fill_gradientn(
    colours = c(
      "grey99", 
      hmap_cols
    ),
    na.value = hmap_cols[5],
    limits = c(0.0, 0.3),
    breaks = c(0.01, 0.3, 0.5),
    labels = function(x) {
      a = scales::percent(x)
      a[x == 0.3] = ">30%"
      a
    },
    name = "% Indiv."
  )+
  scale_x_continuous(
    breaks = c(2500, 3000, 4000, 5000),
    labels = scales::comma_format(
      accuracy = 1
    ),
    name = "Generations",
    sec.axis = dup_axis(
      breaks = sgen,
      labels = "Pathogen introduction",
      name = NULL
    )
  )+
  scale_y_continuous(
    labels = scales::percent,
    name = "% Importance of\nsocial information"
  )+
  coord_cartesian(
    xlim = c(2500, NA),
    ylim = c(0, 0.3)
  )+
  theme_test(
    base_family = "Arial",
    base_size = 8
  )+
  theme(
    legend.position = "top", 
    legend.key.height = unit(1, "mm"),
    legend.key.width = unit(2.5, "mm"),
    legend.title = element_text(
      vjust = 1.5
    ),
    legend.text = element_text(
      size = 6
    ),
    # axis.text.x = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 6),
    axis.text.y = element_text(
      angle = 90, hjust = 0.5  
    )
  )
```

### Intermediate figure SI change

```{r}
fig_evo_intermediate = wrap_plots(
  fig_evo_social_strategy, 
  fig_evo_si_importance,
  guides = "collect"
) &
  plot_annotation(
    tag_levels = "A"
  ) &
  theme(
    plot.tag = element_text(
      face = "bold"
    ),
    legend.position = "bottom",
    legend.justification = "left",
    legend.text = element_text(
      size = 8
    ),
    legend.title = element_text(
      size = 8
    )
  )

# save intermediate figure
ggsave(
  plot = fig_evo_intermediate,
  filename = "figures/fig_evo_intermediate.png",
  width = 120,
  height = 75,
  units = "mm"
)
```

## Data ecological outcomes

Load generation data.

```{r}
# list files, read, and filter for default model options
files = list.files(
  "data/results/gen_data", 
  pattern = "csv",
  full.names = TRUE
)

data_all = lapply(files, fread)
data_all = rbindlist(data_all)

df_eco = data_all[(dispersal == 2) & (infect_percent == F)]
df_eco = df_eco[(cost == 0.25) & (regen == 50)]

# popsize
popsize = 500
g_bin = 100
df_eco[, gen_bin := (floor(gen / g_bin) * g_bin)]

# get time since pathogen
sgen = 3000
genmax = 5000
df_eco[, gen_abs := gen_bin - sgen]

# focus on generations before and after spillover
df_eco[, gen_abs := fifelse(
  abs(gen - sgen) < g_bin, gen - sgen, gen_abs
)]

# save for plotting and upload
fwrite(
  df_eco,
  file = "data/results/data_default_eco.csv"
)
```

```{r}
# load saved data
df_eco = fread("data/results/data_default_eco.csv")
```

### Intake

```{r}
df_eco = df_eco[, c("gen_abs", "intake.mean", 
                    "moved.mean", "assoc.mean")]
df_eco = melt(
  df_eco,
  id.vars = c("gen_abs")
)

## colours for background
cols = colorspace::diverging_hcl(3, palette = "Tofino", l = 50, c = 80)
```

```{r}
plot_intake =
ggplot(df_eco[variable %in% c("intake.mean")])+
  stat_summary(
    aes(
      gen_abs, value
    ),
    col = cols[3],
    geom = "line",
    show.legend = F
  )+
  stat_summary(
    aes(
      gen_abs, value
    ),
    size = 0.1,
    col = cols[3],
    show.legend = F
  )+
  geom_vline(
    xintercept = c(0, 25),
    lty = 2,
    size = 0.3,
    col = c("red", "grey")
  )+
  scale_x_continuous(
    trans = ggallin::pseudolog10_trans,
    breaks = c(-25, 0, 25),
    labels = scales::comma_format(
      accuracy = 1
    ),
    name = "Gens. after pathogen intro.",
    sec.axis = sec_axis(
      trans = function(x) x + sgen,
      breaks = c(1, sgen, genmax),
      labels = scales::comma_format(
        accuracy = 1
      ),
      name = "Generations"
    )
  )+
  theme_test(
    base_family = "Arial",
    base_size = 8
  )+
  theme(
    # legend.position = c(0.2, 0.15),
    legend.key = element_blank(),
    legend.background = element_blank(),
    strip.background = element_blank(),
    strip.text = element_text(
      face = "italic"
    ),
    plot.background = element_blank(),
    strip.placement = "outside"
  )+
  labs(
    x = NULL,
    y = "Per-capita intake",
    colour = NULL,
    shape = NULL
  )
```
